first-contentful-paint: Magento's built-in JS bundling injects large, blocking script requests in the head of the document, blocking the first paint. Consider implementing the [`r.js` method](https://github.com/magento/m2-devtools/blob/master/docs/panels/RequireJS.md).
http-redirects-to-https: Ensure you have set the `use-secure`, `base-url-secure`, and `use-secure-admin` parameters to (always use HTTPS)(https://devdocs.magento.com/guides/v2.3/install-gde/install/cli/install-cli-subcommands-store.html).
https: Ensure you have set the `use-secure`, `base-url-secure`, and `use-secure-admin` parameters to (always use HTTPS)(https://devdocs.magento.com/guides/v2.3/install-gde/install/cli/install-cli-subcommands-store.html).
network-payloads: Disable the built-in bundling feature in Magento, and instead [utilize r.js bundling](https://github.com/magento/m2-devtools/blob/master/docs/panels/RequireJS.md).
optimize-images: See the Magento Marketplace for a variety of 3rd party extensions to optimize images.
preconnect: `<link rel="preconnect" />` tags can be added through the ["Scripts and Style Sheets" store configuration view](https://devdocs.magento.com/guides/v2.3/frontend-dev-guide/layouts/xml-manage.html#layout_markup_css) in the admin interface.
unused-css: Magento does not have built-in support for deferring CSS, but it can be accomplished using 3rd party tools in CI or in local development.
webp: See the Magento Marketplace for a variety of 3rd party extensions to optimize images.
